<@U01E3692GUF> use in DM is primarily so you can communicate about your codebase in large projects with other developers, doing things like pointing out “Hey we locked this folder in the DM, because it’s controlled by a CI/CD set up with this github repository.” It also can be used for licenses. I wouldn’t doubt developers will find some other neat uses for it too.

I hear ya on the wanting to write markdown for blog posts.

Might be a great app integration to build for the marketplace to be totally honest. You could use the blog post APIs.
